It is not clear that CoVs are continuously confined to respiratory illness, indeed they additionally invade the central nervous system (CNS) with neurological diseases. Such neuroinvasive tendency of CoVs has been reported in all β‐CoVs, including HCoV‐229E,
10 SARS‐CoV,
11 MERS‐CoV,
12 HCoV‐OC43,
13 and porcine hemagglutinating encephalomyelitis CoV.
14 ,
15 ,
16 The high resemblance between SARS‐CoV and SARS‐CoV‐2 remains to explore whether the potent neuroinvasion of SARS‐CoV‐2 plays a significant role in COVID‐19 infections.
